sen.j: 『権記』（ごんき）は、平安時代中期に活躍した藤原行成の記した日記。
sen.e: "Gonki" is the diary of FUJIWARA no Yukinari who lived in the middle of the Heian period.
"Gonki" is a diary of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, who lived during the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: added comma and fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: "Gonki" is a diary of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, who lived during the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: 行成卿記、権大納言記とも。
sen.e: Also called Yukinarigyoki, Gondainagonki.
The diary is also called Yukinarigyoki and Gondoinagonki.
sen.cmt: Whether the sentence in translation 1 is referring to the person or the diary is ambiguous, so I added "The diary" for clarity
sen.e: The diary is also called Yukinarigyoki and Gondainagonki.

sen.j: 執筆時期は藤原道長の全盛期で、当時の宮廷状況を知ることができる貴重な史料である。
sen.e: It was written when FUJIWARA no Michinaga was at the height of his prosperity and is an important historical document that describes the situation of the Imperial court at that time.
Gonki was written when FUJIWARA no Michinaga was at the height of his prosperity and is an important historical document that describes the conditions of the Imperial court of the time.
sen.cmt: "situation"→"conditions"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Gonki was written when FUJIWARA no Michinaga was at the height of his prosperity and is an important historical document that describes the conditions of the Imperial Court of the time.

sen.j: 正暦2年（991年）から寛仁元年（1017年）分が一部逸文を含むが伝えられている。
sen.e: The diary runs from 911 to 1017 with some missing periods.
The diary, which is missing a number of writings, reveals events running from 911 to 1017.
sen.cmt: 逸文: unknown or lost writings <http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/cgi-bin/wwwjdic.cgi?1F>; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The diary, which is missing a number of writings, reveals events running from 991 to 1017.

sen.j: 最も古い写本は、鎌倉時代以前に筆写された宮内庁書陵部蔵本。
sen.e: The oldest copy is one that was copied before the Kamakura period and is owned by the Archives and Mausolea Department of the Imperial Household Agency.
The oldest reprint is one that was copied before the Kamakura period and is owned by the Archives and Mausolea Department of the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: "copy" followed by "copied" sounds redundant, so I changed "copy" to "reprint";
sen.e: The oldest reprint is one that was copied before the Kamakura period and is owned by the Archives and Mausolea Department of the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 同時期の日記に『小右記』（藤原実資）、『御堂関白記』（藤原道長）がある。
sen.e: "Shoyuki" (FUJIWARA no Sanesuke) and "Midokanpakuki" (FUJIWARA no Michinaga) are examples of diaries written during the same period.
Other diaries written during the same period are "Shoyuki" (FUJIWARA no Sanesuke) and "Midokanpakuki" (FUJIWARA no Michinaga).
